abstract: Three-nation clinical trial determines that taking antiretroviral drug Truvada protected 76 percent of young, South African women from contracting HIV; previous prevention studies in African women failed after women threw out or failed to take medication; research was funded by National Institutes of Health.
lead_paragraph: A study found that 76 percent of young women in Cape Town, South Africa, who were assigned to take Truvada, a H.I.V.-prevention drug, were willing and able to take the pills daily.

headline.main: Daily H.I.V. Drug Regimen Is Effective in African Women, Study Says
headline.print_headline: Daily H.I.V. Drug Regimen Is Effective in African Women, Study Says

snippet: A study found that 76 percent of young women in Cape Town, South Africa, who were assigned to take Truvada, a H.I.V.-prevention drug, were willing and able to take the pills daily.
